content.question: Which of the following conclusions is most clearly supported by the representations of nucleic acid <math alttext="number 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>#1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and nucleic acid <math alttext="number 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>#2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: Nucleic acid <math alttext="number 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>#1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> contains only purines, whereas nucleic acid <math alttext="number 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>#2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> contains only pyrimidines.

Nucleic acid <math alttext="number 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>#1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> contains the sugar ribose, whereas nucleic acid <math alttext="number 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>#2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> contains the sugar deoxyribose.

Nucleic acid <math alttext="number 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>#1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> contains positively charged phosphate groups, whereas nucleic acid <math alttext="number 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>#2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> does not.

Nucleic acid <math alttext="number 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>#1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> contains adenine-thymine base pairs, whereas nucleic acid <math alttext="number 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>#2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> does not.

content.answer: Nucleic acid <math alttext="number 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>#1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> contains adenine-thymine base pairs, whereas nucleic acid <math alttext="number 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>#2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> does not.

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
